subject: RE: [junit] Don't show exception messages to users (was assertTrue(true))
msgSnippet: ... I just want to restore the proper quotation order here: I am arguing that it makes sense to internationalize exception messages and Elliotte is
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kevin Lawrence

> Elliotte Harold wrote:
> > Cedric Beust wrote:
> > Exception messages should not be shown to the end-user, period. They
> > are for developers, not for users. As such it's not nearly as crucial
> > to localize them since generally either:
> >
> > Of course error messages should be localized. These are shown to the
> > end user and are part of the user interface, just like menu items,
> > window titles, and other parts of the user interface. However,
> > exception detail messages make extremely poor error messages.

I just want to restore the proper quotation order here:

I am arguing that it makes sense to internationalize exception messages and
Elliotte is disagreeing.

I am including my previous message below to be clear.

--
Cédric


> From: Cedric Beust [mailto:cbeust@...]
> Subject: RE: [junit] assertTrue(true)
>
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]
> On Behalf
> > Of Elliotte Harold
>
> > Exception messages should not be shown to the end-user, period.
>
> Depends who your users are. You have probably never used
> WebLogic or any kind of application server...
>
> In these cases, exception messages are the only way users can
> report problems, and not only do these messages need to be
> internationalized, they are actually written by professional
> technical writers from all over the world.
>
> >They are for developers, not for users. As such it's not nearly as
> >crucial to localize them since generally either:
>
> Please, understand that there are a lot of profiles out there
> that are different from your own experience...
